text: Now after the death of Moses the servant of the Lord, the Lord spake unto Joshua the son of Nun, Moses’ minister, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses my servant is dead: now therefore arise, go over this Jordan, thou, and all this people, unto the land which I give them, that is, to the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Every place that the sole of your foot shall tread upon, have I given you, as I said unto Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: From the wilderness and this Lebanon even unto the great river, the river Perath: all the land of the Hittites, even unto the great Sea toward the going down of the sun, shall be your coast.
speaker: Narrator

text: There shall not a man be able to withstand thee all the days of thy life: as I was with Moses, so will I be with thee: I will not leave thee, nor forsake thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be strong and of a good courage: for unto this people shalt thou divide the land for an inheritance, which I swore unto their fathers to give them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only be thou strong, and of a most valiant courage, that thou mayest observe and do according to all the Law which Moses my servant hath commanded thee: thou shalt not turn away from it to the right hand, nor to the left, that thou mayest prosper whithersoever thou goest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Let not this book of the Law depart out of thy mouth, but meditate therein day and night, that thou mayest observe and do according to all that is written therein: for then shalt thou make thy way prosperous, and then shalt thou have good success.
speaker: Narrator

text: Have not I commanded thee, saying, Be strong and of a good courage, fear not, nor be discouraged? for I the Lord thy God will be with thee whithersoever thou goest.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua commanded the officers of the people, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Pass through the host, and command the people, saying, Prepare you victuals: for after three days ye shall pass over this Jordan, to go in to possess the land, which the Lord your God giveth you to possess it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto the Reubenites, and to the Gadites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh spake Joshua, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Remember the word, which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you, saying, The Lord your God hath given you rest, and hath given you this land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Your wives, your children, and your cattle shall remain in the land which Moses gave you on this side Jordan: but ye shall go over before your brethren armed, all that be men of war, and shall help them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Until the Lord have given your brethren rest as well as to you, and until they also shall possess the land, which the Lord your God giveth them: then shall ye return unto the land of your possession, and shall possess it, which land Moses the Lord’s servant gave you on this side Jordan toward the sun rising.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they answered Joshua, saying, All that thou hast commanded us, we will do, and whithersoever thou sendest us, we will go.
speaker: Narrator

text: As we obeyed Moses in all things, so will we obey thee: only the Lord thy God be with thee, as he was with Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Whosoever shall rebel against thy commandment, and will not obey thy words in all that thou commandest him, let him be put to death: only be strong and of good courage.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua the son of Nun sent out of Shittim two men to spy secretly, saying, Go view the land, and also Jericho, and they went, and came into an harlot’s house, named Rahab, and lodged there.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then report was made to the King of Jericho, saying, Behold, there came men hither tonight, of the children of Israel, to spy out the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Jericho sent unto Rahab saying, Bring forth the men that are come to thee, and which are entered into thine house: for they be come to search out all the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But the woman had taken the two men, and hid them.) Therefore said she thus, There came men unto me, but I wist not whence they were.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they shut the gate in the dark, the men went out, whither the men went, I wot not: follow ye after them quickly, for ye shall overtake them.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But she had brought them up to the roof of the house, and hid them with the stalks of flax, which she had spread abroad upon the roof.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And certain men pursued after them, the way to Jordan, unto the fords, and as soon as they which pursued after them, were gone out, they shut the gate.
speaker: Narrator

text: And before they were asleep, she came up unto them upon the roof,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto the men, I know that the Lord hath given you the land, and that the fear of you is fallen upon us, and that all the inhabitants of the land faint because of you.
speaker: Narrator

text: For we have heard how the Lord dried up the water of the red Sea before you when ye came out of Egypt, and what you did unto the two kings of the Amorites, that were on the other side Jordan, unto Sihon and to Og, whom ye utterly destroyed:
speaker: Narrator

text: And when we heard it, our hearts did faint, and there remained no more courage in any because of you: for the Lord your God, he is the God in heaven above, and in earth beneath.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore, I pray you, swear unto me by the Lord, that as I have showed you mercy, ye will also show mercy unto my father’s house, and give me a true token,
speaker: Narrator

text: And that ye will save alive my father and my mother, and my brethren, and my sisters, and all that they have: and that ye will deliver our souls from death.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men answered her, Our life for you to die, if ye utter not this our business: and when the Lord hath given us the land, we will deal mercifully and truly with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she let them down by a cord through the window: for her house was upon the town wall, and she dwelt upon the wall.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she said unto them, Go you into the mountain, lest the pursuers meet with you, and hide yourselves there three days, until the pursuers be returned: then afterward may ye go your way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men said unto her, We will be blameless of this thine oath which thou hast made us swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, when we come into the land, thou shalt bind this cord of red thread in the window, whereby thou lettest us down, and thou shalt bring thy father and thy mother, and thy brethren, and all thy father’s household home to thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: And whosoever then doth go out at the doors of thine house into the street, his blood shall be upon his head, and we will be guiltless: but whosoever shall be with thee in the house, his blood shall be on our head, if any hand touch him:
speaker: Narrator

text: And if thou utter this our matter, we will be quit of thine oath, which thou hast made us swear.
speaker: Narrator

text: And she answered, According unto your words, so be it: then she sent them away, and they departed, and she bound the red cord in the window.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they departed, and came into the mountain, and there abode three days, until the pursuers were returned: and the pursuers sought them throughout all the way, but found them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the two men returned, and descended from the mountain, and passed over, and came to Joshua the son of Nun, and told him all things that came unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also they said unto Joshua, Surely the Lord hath delivered into our hands all the land: for even all the inhabitants of the country faint because of us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua rose very early, and they removed from Shittim, and came to Jordan, he, and all the children of Israel, and lodged there before they went over.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after three days, the officers went throughout the host,
speaker: Narrator

text: And commanded the people, saying, When ye see the Ark of the covenant of the Lord your God and the Priests of the Levites bearing it, ye shall depart from your place, and go after it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet shall there be a space between you and it, about two thousand cubits by measure: ye shall not come near unto it, that ye may know the way, by the which ye shall go: for ye have not gone this way in times past.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Joshua had said unto the people, Sanctify yourselves: for tomorrow the Lord will do wonders among you.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Joshua spake unto the Priests, saying, Take up the Ark of the covenant, and go over before the people: so they took up the Ark of the covenant, and went before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Joshua, This day will I begin to magnify thee in the sight of all Israel, which shall know, that as I was with Moses, so will I be with thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Thou shalt therefore command the Priests that bear the Ark of the covenant, saying, When ye are come to the brink of the waters of Jordan, ye shall stand still in Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said unto the children of Israel, Come hither, and hear the words of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said, Hereby ye shall know that the living God is among you, and that he will certainly cast out before you the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Hivites, and the Perizzites, and the Girgashites, and the Amorites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, the Ark of the covenant of the Lord of all the world passeth before you into Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore take from among you twelve men out of the tribes of Israel, out of every tribe a man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as soon as the soles of the feet of the Priests (that bear the Ark of the Lord God the Lord of all the world) shall stay in the waters of Jordan, the waters of Jordan shall be cut off: for the waters that come from above, shall stand still upon an heap.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then when the people were departed from their tents to go over Jordan, the Priests bearing the Ark of the covenant, went before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they that bare the Ark, came unto Jordan, and the feet of the Priests that bare the Ark were dipped in the brink of the water, (for Jordan useth to fill all his banks all the time of harvest)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the waters that came down from above, stayed and rose upon an heap, and departed far from the city of Adam that was beside Zaretan: but the waters that came down toward the Sea of the wilderness, even the salt Sea, failed and were cut off: so the people went right over against Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Priests that bare the Ark of the covenant of the Lord, stood dry within Jordan ready prepared, and all the Israelites went over dry, until all the people were clean gone over through Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the people were wholly gone over Jordan (after the Lord had spoken unto Joshua, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Take you twelve men out of the people out of every tribe a man,
speaker: Narrator

text: And command you them, saying, Take you hence out of the midst of Jordan, out of the place where the Priests stood in a readiness, twelve stones, which ye shall take away with you, and leave them in the lodging, where you shall lodge this night)
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua called the twelve men, whom he had prepared of the children of Israel, out of every tribe a man,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said unto them, Go over before the Ark of the Lord your God, even through the midst of Jordan, and take up every man of you a stone upon his shoulder according unto the number of the tribes of the children of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: That this may be a sign among you, that when your children shall ask their fathers in time to come, saying, What meant you by these stones?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ye may answer them, That the waters of Jordan were cut off before the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord: for when it passed through Jordan, the waters of Jordan were cut off: therefore these stones are a memorial unto the children of Israel forever.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Israel did even so as Joshua had commanded, and took up twelve stones out of the midst of Jordan as the Lord had said unto Joshua, according unto the number of the tribes of the children of Israel, and carried them away with them unto the lodging, and laid them down there.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua set up twelve stones in the midst of Jordan, in the place where the feet of the Priests, which bare the Ark of the Covenant stood, and there have they continued unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Priests, which bare the Ark, stood in the midst of Jordan, until everything was finished that the Lord had commanded Joshua to say unto the people, according to all that Moses charged Joshua: then the people hasted and went over.
speaker: Narrator

text: When all the people were clean passed over, the Ark of the Lord went over also, and the Priests before the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the sons of Reuben, and the sons of Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh went over before the children of Israel armed, as Moses had charged them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even forty thousand prepared for war, went before the Lord unto battle, into the plain of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: That day the Lord magnified Joshua in the sight of all Israel, and they feared him, as they feared Moses all the days of his life.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord spake unto Joshua, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Command the Priests that bear the Ark of the testimony, to come up out of Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua therefore commanded the Priests, saying, Come ye up out of Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Priests that bare the Ark of the Covenant of the Lord, were come up out of the midst of Jordan, and as soon as the soles of the Priests’ feet were set on the dry land, the waters of Jordan returned unto their place, and flowed over all the banks thereof, as they did before.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people came up out of Jordan the tenth day of the first month, and pitched in Gilgal, in the East side of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the twelve stones, which they took out of Jordan, did Joshua pitch in Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he spake unto the children of Israel, saying, When your children shall ask their fathers in time to come, and say, What mean these stones?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then ye shall show your children, and say, Israel came over this Jordan on dry land:
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord your God dried up the waters of Jordan before you, until ye were gone over as the Lord your God did the red Sea, which he dried up before us, till we were gone over,
speaker: Narrator

text: That all the people of the world may know that the hand of the Lord is mighty, that ye might fear the Lord your God continually.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when all the Kings of the Amorites, which were beyond Jordan Westward, and all the Kings of the Canaanites which were by the Sea, heard that the Lord had dried up the waters of Jordan before the children of Israel until they were gone over, their hearts fainted: and there was no courage in them anymore because of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: That same time the Lord said unto Joshua, Make thee sharp knives, and return, and circumcise the sons of Israel the second time.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua made him sharp knives, and circumcised the sons of Israel in the hill of the foreskins.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this is the cause why Joshua circumcised all the people, even the males that came out of Egypt, because all the men of war were dead in the wilderness by the way after they came out of Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: For all the people that came out, were circumcised: but all the people that were born in the wilderness by the way after they came out of Egypt, were not circumcised.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the children of Israel walked forty years in the wilderness, till all the people of the men of war that came out of Egypt, were consumed, because they obeyed not the voice of the Lord: unto whom the Lord sware that he would not show them the land, which the Lord had sworn unto their fathers, that he would give us, even a land that floweth with milk and honey.
speaker: Narrator

text: So their sons whom he raised up in their stead, Joshua circumcised: for they were uncircumcised, because they circumcised them not by the way.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had made an end of circumcising all the people, they abode in the places in the camp till they were whole.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, the Lord said unto Joshua, This day I have taken away the shame of Egypt from you: wherefore he called the name of that place, Gilgal, unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Israel abode in Gilgal, and kept the feast of the Passover the fourteenth day of the month at even, in the plain of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did eat of the corn of the land, on the morrow after the Passover, unleavened bread, and parched corn in the same day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Manna ceased on the morrow after they had eaten of the corn of the land, neither had the children of Israel Manna anymore, but did eat of the fruit of the land of Canaan that year.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joshua was by Jericho, he lift up his eyes and looked: and behold, there stood a man against him, having a sword drawn in his hand: and Joshua went unto him, and said unto him, Art thou on our side, or on our adversaries?
speaker: Narrator

text: And he said, Nay, but as a captain of the host of the Lord am I now come: then Joshua fell on his face to the earth, and did worship, and said unto him, What saith the Lord unto his servant?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the captain of the Lord’s host said unto Joshua, Loose thy shoe of thy foot: for the place whereon thou standest, is holy: and Joshua did so.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now Jericho was shut up, and closed, because of the children of Israel, none might go out nor enter in.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Joshua, Behold, I have given into thine hand Jericho and the king thereof, and the strong men of war.
speaker: Narrator

text: All ye therefore that be men of war, shall compass the city, in going round about the city once: thus shall you do six days:
speaker: Narrator

text: And seven Priests shall bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the Ark: and the seventh day ye shall compass the city seven times, and the Priests shall blow with the trumpets,
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they make a long blast with the ram’s horn, and ye hear the sound of the trumpet, all the people shall shout with a great shout: then shall the wall of the city fall down flat, and the people shall ascend up, every man straight before him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua the son of Nun called the Priests and said unto them, Take up the Ark of the Covenant, and let seven Priests bear seven trumpets of rams’ horns before the Ark of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But he said unto the people, Go and compass the city: and let him that is armed go forth before the Ark of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joshua had spoken unto the people, the seven priests bare the seven trumpets of rams’ horns, and went forth before the Ark of the Lord, and blew with the trumpets, and the ark of the Covenant of the Lord followed them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of arms went before the priests and blew the trumpets: then the gathering host came after the Ark, and they went and blew the trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: (Now Joshua had commanded the people, saying, Ye shall not shout, neither make any noise with your voice, neither shall a word proceed out of your mouth, until the day that I say unto you, Shout, then shall ye shout.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Ark of the Lord compassed the city, and went about it once: then they returned into the host, and lodged in the camp.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua rose early in the morning, and the Priests bare the Ark of the Lord:
speaker: Narrator

text: Also seven Priests bare seven trumpets of rams’ horns, and went before the Ark of the Lord, and going blew with the trumpets: and the men of arms went before them, but the gathering host came after the Ark of the Lord, as they went and blew the trumpets.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the second day they compassed the city once, and returned into the host: thus they did six days.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the seventh day came, they rose early, even with the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only that day they compassed the city seven times.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the Priests had blown the trumpets the seventh time, Joshua said unto the people, Shout: for the Lord hath given you the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the city shall be an execrable thing, both it, and all that are therein, unto the Lord: only Rahab the harlot shall live, she, and all that are with her in the house: for she hid the messengers that we sent.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, be ye ware of the execrable thing, lest ye make yourselves execrable, and in taking of the execrable thing, make also the host of Israel execrable, and trouble it.
speaker: Narrator

text: But all silver, and gold, and vessels of brass, and iron shall be consecrate unto the Lord, and shall come into the Lord’s treasury.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the people shouted, when they had blown trumpets: for when the people had heard the sound of the trumpets, they shouted with a great shout: and the wall fell down flat: so the people went up into the city, every man straight before him: and they took the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they utterly destroyed all that was in the cities both man and woman, young, and old, and ox, and sheep, and ass with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Joshua had said unto the two men that had spied out the country, Go into the harlot’s house, and bring out thence the woman, and all that she hath, as ye swore to her.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the young men that were spies, went in and brought out Rahab, and her father, and her mother, and her brethren, and all that she had: also they brought out all her family, and put them without the host of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, they burnt the city with fire, and all that was therein: only the silver and the gold, and the vessels of brass and iron, they put unto the treasure of the house of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua saved Rahab the harlot, and her father’s household, and all that she had, and she dwelt in Israel, even unto this day, because she had hid the messengers, which Joshua sent to spy out Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua swore at that time, saying, Cursed be the man before the Lord, that riseth up, and buildeth the city Jericho: he shall lay the foundation thereof in his eldest son, and in his youngest son shall he set up the gates of it.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord was with Joshua, and he was famous through all the world.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the children of Israel committed a trespass in the excommunicate thing: for Achan the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah of the tribe of Judah, took of the excommunicate thing: wherefore the wrath of the Lord was kindled against the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua sent men from Jericho to Ai, which is beside Beth Aven, on the East side of Bethel, and spake unto them, saying, Go up, and view the country. And the men went up and viewed Ai,
speaker: Narrator

text: And returned to Joshua, and said unto him, Let not all the people go up, but let as it were two or three thousand men go up, and smite Ai, and make not all the people to labor thither, for they are few.
speaker: Narrator

text: So there went up thither of the people about three thousand men, and they fled before the men of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Ai smote of them upon a thirty and six men: for they chased them from before the gate unto Shebarim, and smote them in the going down: wherefore the hearts of the people melted away like water.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua rent his clothes, and fell to the earth upon his face before the Ark of the Lord, until the eventide, he, and the Elders of Israel, and put dust upon their heads.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said, Alas, O Lord God, wherefore hast thou brought this people over Jordan, to deliver us into the hand of the Amorites, and to destroy us? would God we had been content to dwell on the other side Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: Oh Lord what shall I say, when Israel turn their backs before their enemies?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Canaanites, and all the inhabitants of the land shall hear of it, and shall compass us, and destroy our name out of the earth: and what wilt thou do unto thy mighty Name?
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Joshua, Get thee up: wherefore liest thou thus upon thy face?
speaker: Narrator

text: Israel hath sinned, and they have transgressed my covenant, which I commanded them: for they have even taken of the excommunicate thing, and have also stolen, and dissembled also, and have put it even with their own stuff.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the children of Israel cannot stand before their enemies: but have turned their backs before their enemies, because they be execrable: neither will I be with you anymore, except ye destroy the excommunicate from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Up therefore, sanctify the people, and say, Sanctify yourselves against tomorrow: for thus saith the Lord God of Israel, There is an execrable thing among you, O Israel, therefore ye cannot stand against your enemies, until ye have put the execrable thing from among you.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the morning therefore ye shall come according to your tribes, and the tribe which the Lord taketh, shall come according to the families: and the family which the Lord shall take, shall come by the households: and the household which the Lord shall take, shall come man by man.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that is taken with the excommunicate thing, shall be burnt with fire, he, and all that he hath, because he hath transgressed the covenant of the Lord, and because he hath wrought folly in Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua rose up early in the morning, and brought Israel by their tribes: and the tribe of Judah was taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought the families of Judah, and took the family of the Zarhites, and he brought the family of the Zarhites, man by man, and Zabdi was taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he brought his household, man by man, and Achan the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah of the tribe of Judah was taken.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said unto Achan, My son, I beseech thee, give glory to the Lord God of Israel, and make confession unto him, and show me now what thou hast done: hide it not from me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Achan answered Joshua, and said, Indeed I have sinned against the Lord God of Israel, and thus, and thus have I done.
speaker: Narrator

text: I saw among the spoil a goodly Babylonish garment, and two hundred shekels of silver, and a wedge of gold of fifty shekels weight, and I covered them, and took them: and behold, they lie hid in the earth in the midst of my tent, and the silver under it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua sent messengers, which ran unto the tent, and behold, it was hid in his tent, and the silver under it.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore they took them out of the tent, and brought them unto Joshua, and unto all the children of Israel, and laid them before the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua took Achan the son of Zerah, and the silver, and the garment, and the wedge of gold, and his sons, and his daughters, and his oxen, and his asses, and his sheep, and his tent, and all that he had: and all Israel with him, brought them unto the valley of Achor.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said, In as much as thou hast troubled us, the Lord shall trouble thee this day: and all Israel threw stones at him, and burned them with fire, and stoned them with stones.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cast upon him a great heap of stones unto this day: and so the Lord turned from his fierce wrath: therefore he called the name of that place, The valley of Achor, unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, the Lord said unto Joshua, Fear not, neither be thou faint hearted: take all the men of war with thee and arise, go up to Ai: behold, I have given into thine hand the king of Ai, and his people, and his city, and his land.
speaker: Narrator

text: And thou shalt do to Ai and to the king thereof, as thou didst unto Jericho and to the king thereof: nevertheless the spoil thereof and the cattle thereof shall ye take unto you for a prey: thou shalt lie in wait against the city on the back side thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua arose, and all the men of war to go up against Ai: and Joshua chose out thirty thousand strong men, and valiant, and sent them away by night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he commanded them, saying, Behold, ye shall lie in wait against the city on the back side of the city: go not very far from the city, but be ye all in a readiness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I and all the people that are with me, will approach unto the city: and when they shall come out against us, as they did at the first time, then will we flee before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For they will come out after us, till we have brought them out of the city: for they will say, They flee before us as at the first time: so we will flee before them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then you shall rise up from lying in wait and destroy the city: for the Lord your God will deliver it into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when ye have taken the city, ye shall set it on fire: according to the commandment of the Lord shall ye do: behold, I have charged you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua then sent them forth, and they went to lie in wait, and abode between Bethel and Ai, on the West side of Ai: but Joshua lodged that night among the people.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua rose up early in the morning, and numbered the people: and he and the Elders of Israel went up before the people against Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also all the men of war that were with him went up and drew near, and came against the city, and pitched on the North side of Ai: and there was a valley between them and Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he took about five thousand men, and set them to lie in wait between Bethel and Ai on the West side of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people set all the host that was on the North side against the city, and the liars in wait on the West, against the city: and Joshua went the same night into the midst of the valley.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when the king of Ai saw it, then the men of the city hasted and rose up early, and went out against Israel to battle, he and all his people, at the time appointed, before the plain: for he knew not that any lay in wait against him on the back side of the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua and all Israel as beaten before them, fled by the way of the wilderness.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the people of the city were called together to pursue after them: and they pursued after Joshua, and were drawn away out of the city,
speaker: Narrator

text: So that there was not a man left in Ai, nor in Bethel, that went not out after Israel: and they left the city open, and pursued after Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Joshua, Stretch out the spear that is in thine hand, toward Ai: for I will give it into thine hand: and Joshua stretched out the spear that he had in his hand, toward the city.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they that lay in wait, arose quickly out of their place, and ran as soon as he had stretched out his hand, and they entered into the city, and took it, and hasted, and set the city on fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Ai looked behind them, and saw it: for lo, the smoke of the city ascended up to heaven, and they had no power to flee this way or that way: for the people that fled to the wilderness, turned back upon the pursuers.
speaker: Narrator

text: When Joshua and all Israel saw that they that lay in wait, had taken the city, and that the smoke of the city mounted up, then they turned again and slew the men of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the other issued out of the city against them: so were they in the midst of Israel, these being on the one side, and the rest on the other side: and they slew them, so that they let none of them remain nor escape.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the King of Ai they took alive, and brought him to Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Israel had made an end of slaying all the inhabitants of Ai in the field, that is, in the wilderness where they chased them, and when they were all fallen on the edge of the sword, until they were consumed, all the Israelites returned unto Ai, and smote it with the edge of the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all that fell that day, both of men and women, were twelve thousand, even all the men of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Joshua drew not his hand back again which he had stretched out with the spear, until he had utterly destroyed all the inhabitants of Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only the cattle and the spoil of this city, Israel took for a prey unto themselves, according unto the word of the Lord, which he commanded Joshua.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua burnt Ai, and made it an heap forever, and a wilderness unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the king of Ai he hanged on a tree, unto the evening. And as soon as the sun was down, Joshua commanded that they should take his carcass down from the tree, and cast it at the entering of the gate of the city, and lay thereon a great heap of stones, that remaineth unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua built an altar unto the Lord God of Israel, in mount Ebal,
speaker: Narrator

text: As Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded the children of Israel, as it is written in the book of the Law of Moses, an altar of whole stone, over which no man had lift an iron: and they offered thereon burnt offerings unto the Lord, and sacrificed peace offerings.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also he wrote there upon the stones, a rehearsal of the Law of Moses, which he wrote in the presence of the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all Israel (and their Elders, and officers and their Judges stood on this side of the Ark, and on that side, before the Priests of the Levites, which bare the Ark of the covenant of the Lord) as well the stranger, as he that is born in the country: half of them were over against mount Gerizim, and half of them over against mount Ebal, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded before, that they should bless the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then afterward he read all the words of the Law, the blessings and cursings, according to all that is written in the book of the Law.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was not a word of all that Moses had commanded, which Joshua read not before all the Congregation of Israel, as well before the women and the children, as the stranger that was conversant among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when all the Kings that were beyond Jordan, in the mountains and in the valleys, and by all the coasts of the great Sea over against Lebanon (as the Hittites, and the Amorites, the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites) heard thereof,
speaker: Narrator

text: They gathered themselves together, to fight against Joshua, and against Israel with one accord.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the inhabitants of Gibeon heard what Joshua had done unto Jericho, and to Ai.
speaker: Narrator

text: And therefore they wrought craftily: for they went, and feigned themselves ambassadors, and took old sacks upon their asses, and old bottles for wine, both rent and bound up,
speaker: Narrator

text: And old shoes and clouted upon their feet: also the raiment upon them was old, and all their provision of bread was dried, and molded.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they came unto Joshua into the host to Gilgal, and said unto him, and unto the men of Israel, We be come from a far country: now therefore make a league with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men of Israel said unto the Hivites, It may be that thou dwellest among us, how then can I make a league with thee?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they said unto Joshua, We are thy servants. Then Joshua said unto them, Who are ye, and whence come ye?
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered him, From a very far country thy servants are come for the Name of the Lord thy God: for we have heard his fame and all that he hath done in Egypt,
speaker: Narrator

text: And all that he hath done to the two kings of the Amorites that were beyond Jordan, to Sihon king of Heshbon, and to Og king of Bashan, which were at Ashtaroth.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore our Elders, and all the inhabitants of our country spake to us, saying, Take vittles with you for the journey, and go to meet them, and say unto them, We are your servants: now therefore make ye a league with us.
speaker: Narrator

text: This our bread we took it hot with us for victuals out of our houses, the day we departed to come unto you: but now behold, it is dried, and it is molded.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also these bottles of wine which we filled, were new, and lo, they be rent, and these our garments and our shoes are old, by reason of the exceeding great journey.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men accepted their tale concerning their victuals, and counseled not with the mouth of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua made peace with them, and made a league with them, that he would suffer them to live: also the Princes of the Congregation swore unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But at the end of three days, after they had made a league with them, they heard that they were their neighbors, and that they dwelt among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel took their journey, and came unto their cities the third day, and their cities were Gibeon, and Chephirah, and Beeroth and Kirjath Jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the children of Israel slew them not, because the Princes of the Congregation had sworn unto them by the Lord God of Israel: wherefore all the Congregation murmured against the Princes.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the Princes said unto all the Congregation, We have sworn unto them by the Lord God of Israel: now therefore we may not touch them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But this we will do to them, and let them live, lest the wrath be upon us, because of the oath which we swore unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Princes said unto them again, Let them live, but they shall hew wood, and draw water unto all the Congregation, as the Princes appoint them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua then called them, and talked with them, and said, Wherefore have ye beguiled us, saying, We are very far from you, when ye dwell among us?
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore ye are accursed, and there shall none of you be freed from being bondmen, and hewers of wood, and drawers of water for the house of my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they answered Joshua, and said, Because it was told thy servants, that the Lord thy God had commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land out of your sight, therefore we were exceeding sore afraid for our lives at the presence of you, and have done this thing:
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold now, we are in thine hand: do as it seemeth good and right in thine eyes to do unto us.
speaker: Narrator

text: Even so did he unto them, and delivered them out of the hand of the children of Israel, that they slew them not.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua appointed them that same day to be hewers of wood, and drawers of water for the Congregation, and for the altar of the Lord unto this day, in the place which he should choose.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Adoni Zedek king of Jerusalem had heard how Joshua had taken Ai and had destroyed it, (for as he had done to Jericho and to the king thereof, so he had done to Ai and to the king thereof) and how the inhabitants of Gibeon had made peace with Israel, and were among them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they feared exceedingly: for Gibeon was a great city, as one of the royal cities: for it was greater than Ai, and all the men thereof were mighty.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore Adoni Zedek king of Jerusalem sent unto Hoham king of Hebron, and unto Piram king of Jarmuth, and unto Japhia king of Lachish, and unto Debir king of Eglon, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Come up unto me, and help me, that we may smite Gibeon: for they have made peace with Joshua and with the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the five kings of the Amorites, the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon, gathered themselves together, and went up, they with all their hosts, and besieged Gibeon, and made war against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the men of Gibeon sent unto Joshua, even to the host to Gilgal, saying, Withdraw not thine hand from thy servants: come up to us quickly, and save us, and help us: for all the kings of the Amorites, which dwell in the mountains, are gathered together against us.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua ascended from Gilgal, he, and all the people of war with him, and all the men of might.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord said unto Joshua, Fear them not: for I have given them into thine hand: none of them shall stand against thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua therefore came unto them suddenly: for he went up from Gilgal all the night.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord discomfited them before Israel, and slew them with a great slaughter at Gibeon, and chased them along the way that goeth up to Beth Horon, and smote them to Azekah, and to Makkedah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as they fled from before Israel, and were in the going down to Beth Horon, the Lord cast down great stones from heaven upon them, until Azekah, and they died: they were more that died with the hailstones, than they whom the children of Israel slew with the sword.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then spake Joshua to the Lord, in the day when the Lord gave the Amorites before the children of Israel, and he said in the sight of Israel, Sun, stay thou in Gibeon, and thou Moon, in the valley of Aijalon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Sun abode, and the moon stood still, until the people avenged themselves upon their enemies: (is not this written in the book of Jasher?) so the Sun abode in the midst of the heaven, and hasted not to go down for a whole day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there was no day like that before it, nor after it, that the Lord heard the voice of a man: for the Lord fought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, Joshua returned, and all Israel with him unto the camp to Gilgal:
speaker: Narrator

text: But the five kings fled and were hid in a cave at Makkedah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it was told Joshua, saying, The five kings are found hid in a cave at Makkedah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said, Roll great stones upon the mouth of the cave, and set men by it for to keep them.
speaker: Narrator

text: But stand ye not still: follow after your enemies, and smite all the hindmost, suffer them not to enter into their cities: for the Lord your God hath given them into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Joshua and the children of Israel had made an end of slaying them with an exceeding great slaughter till they were consumed, and the rest that remained of them were entered into walled cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then all the people returned to the camp, to Joshua at Makkedah in peace: no man moved his tongue against the children of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, Joshua said, Open the mouth of the cave, and bring out these five kings unto me forth of the cave.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they did so, and brought out those five kings unto him forth of the cave, even the king of Jerusalem, the king of Hebron, the king of Jarmuth, the king of Lachish, and the king of Eglon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had brought out those kings unto Joshua, Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said unto the chief of the men of war, which went with him, Come near, set your feet upon the necks of these kings, and they came near, and set their feet upon their necks.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said unto them, Fear not, nor be faint hearted, but be strong and of a good courage: for thus will the Lord do to all your enemies, against whom ye fight.
speaker: Narrator

text: So then Joshua smote them, and slew them, and hanged them on five trees, and they hanged still upon the trees until the evening.
speaker: Narrator

text: And at the going down of the sun, Joshua gave commandment, that they should take them down off the trees, and cast them into the cave (wherein they had been hid) and they laid great stones upon the cave’s mouth, which remain until this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that same day Joshua took Makkedah and smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof destroyed he with them, and all the souls that were therein, he let none remain: for he did to the king of Makkedah, as he had done unto the king of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua went from Makkedah, and all Israel with him unto Libnah, and fought against Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord gave it also and the king thereof into the hand of Israel: and he smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein: he let none remain in it: for he did unto the king thereof, as he had done unto the king of Jericho.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua departed from Libnah, and all Israel with him unto Lachish, and besieged it, and assaulted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord gave Lachish into the hand of Israel, which took it the second day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein, according to all as he had done to Libnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Horam king of Gezer came up to help Lachish: but Joshua smote him and his people, until none of his remained.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from Lachish Joshua departed unto Eglon, and all Israel with him, and they besieged it, and assaulted it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they took it the same day, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and all the souls that were therein he utterly destroyed the same day, according to all that he had done to Lachish.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua went up from Eglon, and all Israel with him unto Hebron, and they fought against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they had taken it, they smote it with the edge of the sword, and the king thereof, and all the cities thereof, and all the souls that were therein: he left none remaining, according to all as he had done to Eglon: for he destroyed it utterly, and all the souls that were therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua returned, and all Israel with him to Debir, and fought against it.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when he had taken it, and the king thereof, and all the city thereof, they smote them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed all the souls that were therein, he let none remain: as he did to Hebron, so he did to Debir, and to the king thereof, as he had also done to Libnah, and to the king thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua smote all the hill countries, and the South countries, and the valleys, and the hillsides, and all their kings, and let none remain, but utterly destroyed every soul, as the Lord God of Israel had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua smote them from Kadesh Barnea even unto Gaza, and all the country of Goshen, even unto Gibeon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all these kings, and their land did Joshua take at one time, because the Lord God of Israel fought for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Afterward, Joshua and all Israel with him returned unto the camp in Gilgal.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Jabin king of Hazor had heard this, then he sent to Jobab king of Madon, and to the king of Shimron, and to the king of Achshaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto the kings that were by the North in the mountains and plains toward the South side of Chinneroth, and in the valleys, and in the borders of Dor Westward,
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto the Canaanites, both by East, and by West, and unto the Amorites, and Hittites, and Perizzites, and Jebusites in the mountains, and unto the Hivites, under Hermon in the land of Mizpah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they came out, and all their hosts with them, many people, as the sand that is on the seashore, for multitude, with horses and chariots exceeding many.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all these kings met together, and came and pitched together at the waters of Merom, for to fight against Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the Lord said unto Joshua, Be not afraid for them: for tomorrow about this time will I deliver them all slain before Israel: thou shalt hough their horses, and burn their chariots with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came Joshua and all the men of war with him, against them, by the waters of Merom suddenly, and fell upon them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord gave them into the hand of Israel: and they smote them, and chased them unto great Sidon, and unto Misrephoth, and unto the valley of Mizpah Eastward, and smote them until they had none remaining of them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua did unto them as the Lord bade him: he houghed their horses, and burnt their chariots with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: At that time also Joshua turned back, and took Hazor, and smote the King thereof with the sword: for Hazor beforetime was the head of all those kingdoms.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moreover they smote all the persons that were therein with the edge of the sword, utterly destroying all, leaving none alive, and he burnt Hazor with fire.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them did Joshua take, and smote them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed them, as Moses the servant of the Lord had commanded.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Israel burnt none of the cities that stood still in their strength, save Hazor only, that Joshua burnt.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the spoil of these cities and the cattle, the children of Israel took for their prey, but they smote every man with the edge of the sword until they had destroyed them, not leaving one alive.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord had commanded Moses his servant, so did Moses command Joshua, and so did Joshua, he left nothing undone of all that the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua took all this land of the mountains, and all the South, and all the land of Goshen, and the low country, and the plain, and the mountain of Israel, and the low country of the same,
speaker: Narrator

text: From the mount Halak, that goeth up to Seir, even unto Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon, under mount Hermon: and all their kings he took, and smote them, and slew them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua made war [a] long time with all those Kings,
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither was there any city that made peace with the children of Israel, save those Hivites that inhabited Gibeon: all others they took by battle.
speaker: Narrator

text: For it came of the Lord, to harden their hearts that they should come against Israel in battle, to the intent that they should destroy them utterly, and show them no mercy, but that they should bring them to nought, as the Lord had commanded Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that same season came Joshua, and destroyed the Anakims out of the mountains: as out of Hebron, out of Debir, out of Anab, and out of all the mountains of Judah, and out of all the mountains of Israel: Joshua destroyed them utterly with their cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: There was no Anakim left in the land of the children of Israel, only in Gaza, in Gath, and in Ashdod were they left.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua took the whole land, according to all that the Lord had said unto Moses: and Joshua gave it for an inheritance unto Israel, according to their portions through their tribes: then the land was at rest without war.
speaker: Narrator

text: And these are the Kings of the land, which the children of Israel smote and possessed their land on the other side Jordan toward the rising of the sun, from the river Arnon, unto mount Hermon, and all the plain Eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: Sihon king of the Amorites, that dwelt in Heshbon, having dominion from Aroer, which is beside the river of Arnon, and from the middle of the river, and from half Gilead unto the river of Jabbok, in the border of the children of Ammon.
speaker: Narrator

text: And from the plain unto the sea of Chinneroth Eastward, and unto the sea of the plain, even the salt sea Eastward, the way to Beth Jeshimoth, and from the South under the springs of Pisgah.
speaker: Narrator

text: They conquered also the coast of Og king of Bashan of the remnant of the giants, which dwelt at Ashtaroth, and at Edrei,
speaker: Narrator

text: And reigned in mount Hermon, and in Salcah, and in all Bashan, unto the border of the Geshurites, and the Maachathites, and half Gilead: even the border of Sihon king of Heshbon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses the servant of the Lord, and the children of Israel smote them: Moses also the servant of the Lord gave their land for a possession unto the Reubenites, and unto the Gadites, and to half the tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are the kings of the country, which Joshua and the children of Israel smote on this side Jordan, Westward from Baal Gad in the valley of Lebanon, even unto the mount Halak that goeth up to Seir, and Joshua gave it unto the tribes of Israel for a possession, according to their portions.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the mountains, and in the valleys, and in the plains, and in the hillsides, and in the wilderness, and in the South, where were the Hittites, the Amorites, and the Canaanites, the Perizzites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites.
speaker: Narrator

text: The King of Jericho was one: the king of Ai, which is beside Bethel, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Jerusalem, one: the king of Hebron, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Jarmuth, one: the king of Lachish, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Eglon, one: the king of Gezer, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Debir, one: the king of Geder, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Hormah, one: the king of Arad, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Libnah, one: the king of Adullam, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Makkedah, one: the king of Bethel, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Tappuah, one: the king of Hepher, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Aphek, one: the king of Lasharon, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Madon, one: the king of Hazor, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Shimron Meron, one: the king of Achshaph, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Taanach, one: the king of Megiddo, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Kedesh, one: the king of Jokneam of Carmel, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Dor, in the country of Dor, one: the king of the nations of Gilgal, one:
speaker: Narrator

text: The king of Tirzah, one. All the kings were thirty and one.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now when Joshua was old, and stricken in years, the Lord said unto him, Thou art old and grown in age, and there remaineth exceeding much land to be possessed:
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the land that remaineth, all the regions of the Philistines, and all Geshuri.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Nilus which is in Egypt, even unto the borders of Ekron Northward: this is counted of the Canaanites, even five Lordships of the Philistines, the Gazites, and the Ashdodites, the Ashkelonites, the Gittites, and the Ekronites, and the Avites:
speaker: Narrator

text: From the South, all the land of the Canaanites, and the cave that is beside the Sidonians, unto Aphek, and to the borders of the Amorites:
speaker: Narrator

text: And the land of the Gebalites, and all Lebanon toward the Sun rising from Baal Gad under mount Hermon, until one come to Hamath.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the inhabitants of the mountains from Lebanon unto Misrephoth, and all the Sidonians, I will cast them out from before the children of Israel: only divide thou it by lot unto the Israelites, to inherit, as I have commanded thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore divide this land to inherit, unto the nine tribes, and to the half tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: For with half thereof the Reubenites and the Gadites have received their inheritance, which Moses gave them beyond Jordan Eastward, even as Moses the servant of the Lord had given them.
speaker: Narrator

text: From Aroer that is on the brink of the river Arnon, and from the city that is in the midst of the river, and all the plain of Medeba unto Dibon,
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the cities of Sihon king of the Amorites, which reigned in Heshbon, unto the borders of the children of Ammon,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gilead, and the borders of the Geshurites and of the Maachathites, and all mount Hermon, with all Bashan unto Salcah:
speaker: Narrator

text: All the kingdom of Og in Bashan, which reigned in Ashtaroth and in Edrei: (who remained of the rest of the giants) for these did Moses smite, and cast them out:
speaker: Narrator

text: But the children of Israel expelled not the Geshurites nor the Maachathites: but the Geshurites and the Maachathites dwell among the Israelites even unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: Only unto the tribe of Levi he gave none inheritance, but the sacrifices of the Lord God of Israel are his inheritance, as he said unto him.
speaker: Narrator

text: Moses then gave unto the tribe of the children of Reuben inheritance, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their coast was from Aroer, that is on the brink of the river Arnon, and from the city that is in the midst of the river, and all the plain which is by Medeba:
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with all the cities thereof, that are in the plain: Dibon and Bamoth Baal, and Beth Baal Meon:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jahaza, and Kedemoth, and Mephaath:
speaker: Narrator

text: Kirjathaim also, and Sibmah, and Zereth Shahar in the mount of Emek:
speaker: Narrator

text: And Beth Peor, and Ashdoth Pisgah, and Beth Jeshimoth:
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the cities of the plain, and all the kingdom of Sihon king of the Amorites, which reigned in Heshbon, whom Moses smote with the Princes of Midian, Evi and Rekem, and Zur, and Hur, and Reba, the dukes of Sihon, dwelling in the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Balaam the son of Beor the soothsayer did the children of Israel slay with the sword, among them that were slain.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the border of the children of Reuben was Jordan with the coasts. This was the inheritance of the children of Reuben according to their families, with the cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Moses gave inheritance unto the tribe of Gad, even unto the children of Gad according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their coasts were Jazer, and all the cities of Gilead, and half the land of the children of Ammon unto Aroer, which is before Rabbah:
speaker: Narrator

text: And from Heshbon unto Ramath, Mizpah, and Betonim: and from Mahanaim unto the borders of Debir:
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the valley of Beth Haram, and Beth Nimrah, and Succoth, and Zaphon, the rest of the kingdom of Sihon king of Heshbon unto Jordan and the borders even unto the sea coast of Chinnereth, beyond Jordan Eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the children of Gad, after their families, with the cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Moses gave inheritance unto the half tribe of Manasseh: and this belonged to the half tribe of the children of Manasseh according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their border was from Mahanaim, even all Bashan, to wit, all the kingdom of Og king of Bashan, and all the towns of Jair which are in Bashan, threescore cities,
speaker: Narrator

text: And half Gilead, and Ashtaroth, and Edrei, cities of the kingdom of Og in Bashan, were given unto the children of Machir the son of Manasseh to half of the children of Machir after their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the heritages, which Moses did distribute in the plain of Moab beyond Jordan toward Jericho Eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: But unto the tribe of Levi Moses gave none inheritance: for the Lord God of Israel is their inheritance, as he said unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: These also are the places which the children of Israel inherited in the land of Canaan, which Eleazar the Priest, and Joshua the son of Nun and the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel, distributed to them,
speaker: Narrator

text: By the lot of their inheritance, as the Lord had commanded by the hand of Moses, to give to the nine tribes, and the half tribe.
speaker: Narrator

text: For Moses had given inheritance unto two tribes and an half tribe, beyond Jordan: but unto the Levites he gave none inheritance among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the children of Joseph were two tribes, Manasseh and Ephraim, therefore they gave no part unto the Levites in the land, save cities to dwell in, with the suburbs of the same for their beasts and their substance.
speaker: Narrator

text: As the Lord had commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did when they divided the land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Judah came unto Joshua in Gilgal: and Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite said unto him, Thou knowest what the Lord said unto Moses the man of God, concerning thee and me in Kadesh Barnea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Forty years old was I, when Moses the servant of the Lord sent me from Kadesh Barnea to espy the land, and I brought him word again, as I thought in mine heart.
speaker: Narrator

text: But my brethren that went up with me, discouraged the heart of the people: yet I followed still the Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Wherefore Moses swore the same day, saying, Certainly the land whereon thy feet have trodden, shall be thine inheritance, and thy children’s forever, because thou hast followed constantly the Lord my God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore behold now, the Lord hath kept me alive, as he promised: this is the forty and fifth year since the Lord spake this thing unto Moses, while the children of Israel wandered in the wilderness: and now lo, I am this day four score and five years old:
speaker: Narrator

text: And yet am as strong at this time, as I was when Moses sent me: as strong as I was then, so strong am I now, either for war, or for government.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore give me this mountain whereof the Lord spake in that day (for thou heardest in that day, how the Anakim were there, and the cities great and walled) if so be the Lord will be with me that I may drive them out, as the Lord said.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua blessed him, and gave unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh, Hebron for an inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Hebron therefore became the inheritance of Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, unto this day: because he followed constantly the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the name of Hebron was before time, Kirjath Arba: which Arba was a great man among the Anakim: thus the land ceased from war.
speaker: Narrator

text: This then was the lot of the tribe of the children of Judah by their families: even to the border of Edom and the wilderness of Zin, Southward on the South coast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their South border was the salt Sea coast, from the point that looketh Southward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And it went out on the South side toward Maaleh Akrabbim, and went along to Zin, and ascended up on the South side unto Kadesh Barnea, and went along to Hezron, and went up to Adar, and set a compass to Karkaa.
speaker: Narrator

text: From thence went it along to Azmon, and reached unto the river of Egypt, and the end of that coast was on the West side: this shall be your South coast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the East border shall be the salt Sea, unto the end of Jordan: and the border on the North quarter from the point of the Sea, and from the end of Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this border goeth up to Beth Hoglah, and goeth along by the North side of Beth Arabah: so the border from thence goeth up to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
speaker: Narrator

text: Again this border goeth up to Debir from the valley of Achor, and Northward, turning toward Gilgal, that lieth before the going unto Adummim, which is on the South side of the river: also this border goeth up to the waters of En Shemesh, and endeth at En Rogel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then this border goeth up to the valley of the son of Hinnom; on the South side of the Jebusites: the same is Jerusalem. Also this border goeth up to the top of the mountain that lieth before the valley of Hinnom Westward, which is by the end of the valley of giants Northward.
speaker: Narrator

text: So this border compasseth from the top of the mountain unto the fountain of the water of Nephtoah, and goeth out to the cities of mount Ephron: and this border draweth to Baalah which is Kirjath Jearim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then this border compasseth from Baalah Westward unto mount Seir, and goeth along unto the side of mount Jearim, which is Chesalon on the North side: it cometh down to Beth Shemesh, and goeth to Timnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also this border goeth out unto the side of Ekron Northward: and this border draweth to Shicron, and goeth along to mount Baalah, and stretcheth unto Jabneel: and the ends of this coast are unto the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the West border is to the great sea: so this border shall be the bounds of the children of Judah round about, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And unto Caleb the son of Jephunneh did Joshua give a part among the children of Judah, as the Lord commanded him, even Kirjath Arba of the father of Anak which is in Hebron.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Caleb drove thence three sons of Anak, Sheshai, and Ahiman, and Talmai, the sons of Anak.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he went up thence to the inhabitants of Debir: and the name of Debir beforetime was Kirjath Sepher.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Caleb said, He that smiteth Kirjath Sepher, and taketh it, even to him will I give Achsah my daughter to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Othniel the son of Kenaz, the brother of Caleb took it: and he gave him Achsah his daughter to wife.
speaker: Narrator

text: And as she went in to him, she moved him, to ask of her father a field: and she lighted off her ass, and Caleb said unto her, What wilt thou?
speaker: Narrator

text: Then she answered, Give me a blessing: for thou hast given me the South country: give me also springs of water. And he gave her the springs above, and the springs beneath.
speaker: Narrator

text: This shall be the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Judah according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the utmost cities of the tribe of the children of Judah, toward the coasts of Edom Southward were Kabzeel, and Eder, and Jagur,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Kinah, and Dimonah, and Adadah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Kedesh, and Hazor, and Ithnan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ziph, and Telem, and Bealoth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hazor, Hadattah, and Kerioth, Hezron (which is Hazor.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Amam, and Shema, and Moladah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hazar, Gaddah, and Heshmon, and Beth Pelet,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hazar Shual, and Beersheba, and Bizjothjah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Baalah, and Ijim, and Ezem,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eltolad, and Chesil, and Hormah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ziklag, and Madmannah, and Sansannah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Lebaoth, and Shilhim, and Ain, and Rimmon: all these cities are twenty-nine with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the low country were Eshtaol, and Zorah, and Ashnah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zanoah, and En Gannim, Tappuah, and Enam,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth, and Adullam, Socoh, and Azekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Sharaim, and Adithaim, and Gederah, and Gederothaim: fourteen cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Zenan, and Hadashah, and Migdal Gad,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Dilean, and Mizpah, and Joktheel,
speaker: Narrator

text: Lachish, and Bozkath, and Eglon,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Cabbon, and Lahmas, and Kithlish,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Gederoth, Beth Dagon, and Naamah, and Makkedah: sixteen cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Libnah, and Ether, and Ashan,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jiphtah, and Ashnah, and Nezib,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Keilah, and Achzib, and Mareshah: nine cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ekron with her towns and her villages,
speaker: Narrator

text: From Ekron, even unto the Sea, all that lieth about Ashdod with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ashdod with her towns and her villages: Gaza with her towns and her villages unto the river of Egypt, and the great Sea was their coast.
speaker: Narrator

text: And in the mountains were Shamir, and Jattir, and Sochoh,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Dannah, and Kirjath Sannah (which is Debir.)
speaker: Narrator

text: And Anab, and Eshtemoh, and Anim,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Goshen, and Holon, and Giloh: eleven cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Arab, and Dumah, and Eshean,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Janum, and Beth Tappuah, and Aphekah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Humtah, and Kirjath Arba, (which is Hebron) and Zior: nine cities with their villages,
speaker: Narrator

text: Maon, Carmel, and Ziph, and Juttah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jezreel, and Jokdeam, and Zanoah,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kain, Gibeah, and Timnah: ten cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Halhul, Beth Zur, and Gedor,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Maarath, and Beth Anoth, and Eltekon: six cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Kirjath Baal, which is Kirjath Jearim, and Rabbah: two cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: In the wilderness were Beth Arabah, Middin, and Secacah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Nibshan, and the city of salt, and En Gedi: five cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, the Jebusites that were the inhabitants of Jerusalem, could not the children of Judah cast out, but the Jebusites dwell with the children of Judah at Jerusalem unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lot fell to the children of Joseph from Jordan by Jericho unto the water of Jericho Eastward, and to the wilderness that goeth up from Jericho by the mount Bethel:
speaker: Narrator

text: And goeth out from Bethel to Luz, and runneth along unto the borders of Archi Ataroth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And goeth down Westward to the coast of Japhlet, unto the coast of Beth Horon the nether: and to Gezer, and the ends thereof are at the Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Joseph; Manasseh and Ephraim took their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the borders of the children of Ephraim according to their families, even the borders of their inheritance on the East side were Ataroth Addar, unto Beth Horon the upper.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this border goeth out to the Sea unto Michmethath on the North side, and this border returneth Eastward unto Taanath Shiloh, and passeth it on the East side unto Janohah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And goeth down from Janohah unto Ataroth, and Naarah, and cometh to Jericho, and goeth out at Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this border goeth from Tappuah Westward unto the river Kanah, and the ends thereof are at the Sea: this is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Ephraim by their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the separate cities for the children of Ephraim were among the inheritance of the children of Manasseh: all the cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they cast not out the Canaanite that dwelt in Gezer, but the Canaanite dwelt among the Ephraimites unto this day, and served under tribute.
speaker: Narrator

text: This was also the lot of the tribe of Manasseh: for he was the firstborn of Joseph, to wit, of Machir the firstborn of Manasseh, and the father of Gilead: now because he was a man of war, he had Gilead and Bashan.
speaker: Narrator

text: And also of the rest of the sons of Manasseh by their families, even of the sons of Abiezer, and of the sons of Helek, and of the sons of Asriel, and of the sons of Shechem, and of the sons of Hepher, and of the sons of Shemida: these were the males of Manasseh, the son of Joseph according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: But Zelophehad the son of Hepher, the son of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, had no sons, but daughters: and these are the names of his daughters, Mahlah, and Noah, Hoglah, Milcah and Tirzah:
speaker: Narrator

text: Which came before Eleazar the Priest, and before Joshua the son of Nun, and before the princes, saying, The Lord commanded Moses to give us an inheritance among our brethren: therefore according to the commandment of the Lord, he gave them an inheritance among the brethren of their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: And there fell ten portions to Manasseh, beside the land of Gilead and Bashan, which is on the other side of Jordan,
speaker: Narrator

text: Because the daughters of Manasseh did inherit among his sons: and Manasseh’s other sons had the land of Gilead.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the borders of Manasseh were from Asher to Michmethath that lieth before Shechem, and this border goeth on the right hand, even to the inhabitants of En Tappuah.
speaker: Narrator

text: The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh, but Tappuah beside the border of Manasseh belongeth to the sons of Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also this border goeth down unto the river Kanah Southward to the river: these cities of Ephraim are among the cities of Manasseh: and the border of Manasseh is on the North side of the river, and the ends of it are at the Sea,
speaker: Narrator

text: The South pertaineth to Ephraim, and the North to Manasseh, and the sea is his border: and they met together in Asher Northward, and in Issachar Eastward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Manasseh had in Issachar and in Asher, Beth Shean, and her towns, and Ibleam, and her towns, and the inhabitants of Dor with the towns thereof, and the inhabitants of En Dor with the towns thereof, and the inhabitants of Taanach with her towns, and the inhabitants of Megiddo with the towns of the same, even three countries.
speaker: Narrator

text: Yet the children of Manasseh could not destroy those cities, but the Canaanites dwelled still in that land.
speaker: Narrator

text: Nevertheless, when the children of Israel were strong, they put the Canaanites under tribute, but cast them not out wholly.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Joseph spake unto Joshua, saying, Why hast thou given me but one lot, and one portion to inherit, seeing I am a great people, forasmuch as the Lord hath blessed me hitherto?
speaker: Narrator

text: Joshua then answered them, If thou be much people, get thee up to the woods, and cut trees for thyself there in the land of the Perizzites, and of the giants, if mount Ephraim be too narrow for thee.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Joseph said, The mountain will not be enough for us: and all the Canaanites that dwell in the low country have chariots of iron, as well they in Beth Shean, and in the towns of the same, as they in the valley of Jezreel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua spake unto the house of Joseph, to Ephraim and to Manasseh, saying, Thou art a great people, and hast great power, and shalt not have one lot.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore the mountain shall be thine: for it is a wood, and thou shalt cut it down: and the ends of it shall be thine, and thou shalt cast out the Canaanites, though they have iron chariots, and though they be strong.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the whole Congregation of the children of Israel came together at Shiloh: for they set up the Tabernacle of the Congregation there, after the land was subject unto them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now there remained among the children of Israel seven tribes, to whom they had not divided their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore Joshua said unto the children of Israel, how long are you so slack to enter and possess the land which the Lord God of your fathers hath given you?
speaker: Narrator

text: Give from among you for every tribe three men, that I may send them, and that they may rise and walk through the land, and distribute it according to their inheritance, and return to me.
speaker: Narrator

text: And that they may divide it unto them into seven parts, (Judah shall abide in his coast at the South, and the house of Joseph shall stand in their coasts at the North.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye shall describe the land therefore into seven parts, and shall bring them hither to me, and I will cast lots for you here before the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the Levites shall have no part among you: for the Priesthood of the Lord is their inheritance: also Gad and Reuben and half the tribe of Manasseh have received their inheritance beyond Jordan Eastward, which Moses the servant of the Lord gave them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the men arose, and went their way, and Joshua charged them that went to describe the land, saying, Depart, and go through the land, and describe it, and return to me, that I may here cast lots for you before the Lord in Shiloh.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the men departed, and passed through the land, and described it by cities into seven parts in a book, and returned to Joshua into the camp at Shiloh.
speaker: Narrator
