text: Then Joshua cast lots for them in Shiloh before the Lord, and there Joshua divided the land unto the children of Israel, according to their portions.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lot of the tribe of the children of Benjamin came forth according to their families, and the cost of their lot lay between the children of Judah, and the children of Joseph.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their coast on the North side was from Jordan, and the border went up to the side of Jericho on the North part, and went up through the mountains Westward, and the ends thereof are in the wilderness of Beth Aven:
speaker: Narrator

text: And this border goeth along from thence to Luz, even to the South side of Luz (the same is Bethel) and this border descendeth to Ataroth Addar, near the mount that lieth on the South side of Beth Horon the nether.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the border turneth, and compasseth the corner of the Sea Southward, from the mount that lieth before Beth Horon Southward: and the ends thereof are at Kirjath Baal (which is Kirjath Jearim) a city of the children of Judah: this is the West quarter.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the South quarter is from the end of Kirjath Jearim, and this border goeth out Westward, and cometh to the fountain of waters of Nephtoah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this border descendeth at the end of the mountain, that lieth before the valley of Ben Hinnom, which is in the valley of the giants Northward, and descendeth into the valley of Hinnom by the side of Jebus Southward, and goeth down to En Rogel,
speaker: Narrator

text: And compasseth from the North, and goeth forth to En Shemesh, and stretcheth to Geliloth, which is toward the going up unto Adummim, and goeth down to the stone of Bohan the son of Reuben.
speaker: Narrator

text: So it goeth along to the side over against the plain Northward, and goeth down into the plain.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, this border goeth along to the side of Beth Hoglah Northward: and the ends thereof, that is, of the border, reach to the point of the salt Sea Northward, and to the end of Jordan Southward: this is the South coast.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Jordan is the border of it on the East side: this is the inheritance of the children of Benjamin by the coasts thereof round about, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now the cities of the tribe of the children of Benjamin, according to their families, are Jericho, and Beth Hoglah, and the valley of Keziz,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Beth Arabah, and Zemaraim, and Bethel,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Avim, and Parah, and Ophrah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Chephar, Haammoni, and Ophni, and Gaba: twelve cities with their villages:
speaker: Narrator

text: Gibeon, and Ramah, and Beeroth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Mizpah, and Chephirah, and Mozah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rekem, and Irpeel, and Taralah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Zelah, Eleph, and Jebus, (which is Jerusalem) Gibeath, and Kirjath: fourteen cities with their villages: this is the inheritance of the children of Benjamin, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the second lot came out to Simeon, even for the tribe of the children of Simeon, according to their families: and their inheritance was in the midst of the inheritance of the children of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now they had in their inheritance Beersheba, and Sheba, and Moladah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Hazar Shual, and Balah, and Ezem,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eltolad, and Bethul, and Hormah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ziklag, and Beth Marcaboth, and Hazar Susah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Beth Lebaoth, and Sharuhen: thirteen cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Ain, Rimmon, and Ether, and Ashan: four cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the villages that were round about these cities, unto Baalath Beer, and Ramah, Southward: this is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Simeon, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: Out of the portion of the children of Judah came the inheritance of the children of Simeon: for the part of the children of Judah was too much for them: therefore the children of Simeon had their inheritance within their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the third lot arose for the children of Zebulun, according to their families: and the coasts of their inheritance came to Sarid,
speaker: Narrator

text: And their border goeth up Westward, even to Maralah, and reacheth to Dabbasheth, and meeteth with the river that lieth before Jokneam,
speaker: Narrator

text: And turneth from Sarid Eastward toward the Sun rising unto the border of Chisloth Tabor, and goeth out to Daberath, and ascendeth to Japhia,
speaker: Narrator

text: And from thence goeth along Eastward toward the Sun rising to Gath Hepher, to Eth Kazin, and goeth forth to Rimmon, and turneth to Neah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this border compasseth it on the North side to Hannathon, and the ends thereof are in the valley of Jiphthah El,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Kattath, and Nahallal, and Shimron, and Idalah, and Bethlehem: twelve cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the children of Zebulun, according to their families, that is, these cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The fourth lot came out to Issachar, even for the children of Issachar, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their coast was Jezreel, and Chesulloth, and Shunem,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Haphraim, and Shion, and Anaharath,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Rabbith, and Kishion, and Abez,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Remeth, and En Gannim, and En Haddah, and Beth Pazzez.
speaker: Narrator

text: And this coast reacheth to Tabor, and Shahazimah, and Beth Shemesh, and the ends of their coast reach to Jordan: sixteen cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Issachar according to their families: that is, the cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the fifth lot came out for the tribe of the children of Asher according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their coast was Helkath, and Hali, and Beten, and Achshaph,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Alammelech, and Amad, and Mishal, and came to Carmel Westward, and to Shihor Libnath,
speaker: Narrator

text: And turneth toward the Sun rising to Beth Dagon, and cometh to Zebulun, and to the valley of Jiphthah El, toward the North side of Beth Emek, and Neiel, and goeth out on the left side of Cabul,
speaker: Narrator

text: And to Ebron, and Rehob, and Hammon, and Kanah, unto great Sidon.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the coast turneth to Ramah and to the strong city of Zor, and this border turneth to Hosah, and the ends thereof are at the Sea from Hebel to Achzib,
speaker: Narrator

text: Ummah also and Aphek, and Rehob: two and twenty cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Asher, according to their families: that is, these cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The sixth lot came out to the children of Naphtali, even to the children of Naphtali according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And their coast was from Heleph, and from Allon in Zaanannim, and Adami Nekeb, and Jabneel, even to Lakkum, and the ends thereof are at Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: So this coast turneth Westward to Aznoth Tabor, and goeth out from thence to Hukkok, and reacheth to Zebulun on the South side, and goeth to Asher on the West side, and to Judah by Jordan toward the sun rising.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the strong cities are Ziddim, Zer, and Hammath, Rakkath, and Chinnereth,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Adamah, and Ramah, and Hazor,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Kedesh, and Edrei, and En Hazor,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Iron, and Migdal El, Horem, and Beth Anath, and Beth Shemesh: nineteen cities with their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Naphtali according to their families: that is, the cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: The seventh lot came out for the tribe of the children of Dan, according to their families.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the coast of their inheritance was Zorah, and Eshtaol, and Ir Shemesh,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Shaalabbin, and Aijalon, and Jethlah,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Elon, and Timnah, and Ekron,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Eltekeh, and Gibbethon, and Baalath,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jehud, and Bene Berak, and Gath Rimmon,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Me Jarkon, and Rakkon, with the border that lieth before Japho.
speaker: Narrator

text: But the coast of the children of Dan fell out too little for them: therefore the children of Dan went up to fight against Leshem, and took it, and smote it with the edge of the sword, and possessed it, and dwelt therein, and called Leshem, Dan after the name of Dan their father.
speaker: Narrator

text: This is the inheritance of the tribe of the children of Dan according to their families: that is, these cities and their villages.
speaker: Narrator

text: When they had made an end of dividing the land by the coasts thereof, then the children of Israel gave an inheritance unto Joshua the son of Nun among them.
speaker: Narrator

text: According to the word of the Lord they gave him the city which he asked, even Timnath Serah in mount Ephraim: and he built the city and dwelt therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: These are the heritages which Eleazar the Priest, and Joshua the son of Nun, and the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel divided by lot in Shiloh before the Lord at the door of the Tabernacle of the Congregation: so they made an end of dividing the country.
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord also spake unto Joshua, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Speak to the children of Israel, and say, Appoint you cities of refuge, whereof I spake unto you by the hand of Moses,
speaker: Narrator

text: That the slayer that killeth any person by ignorance, and unwittingly, may flee thither, and they shall be your refuge from the avenger of blood.
speaker: Narrator

text: And he that doth flee unto one of those cities, shall stand at the entering of the gate of the city, and shall show his cause to the Elders of the city: and they shall receive him into the city unto them, and give him a place, that he may dwell with them.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if the avenger of blood pursue after him, they shall not deliver the slayer into his hand, because he smote his neighbor ignorantly, neither hated he him beforetime:
speaker: Narrator

text: But he shall dwell in that city until he stand before the Congregation in judgment, or until the death of the high Priest that shall be in those days: then shall the slayer return, and come unto his own city, and unto his own house, even unto the city from whence he fled.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they appointed Kedesh in Galilee in mount Naphtali, and Shechem in mount Ephraim, and Kirjath Arba, (which is Hebron) in the mountain of Judah.
speaker: Narrator

text: And on the other side Jordan toward Jericho Eastward, they appointed Bezer in the wilderness upon the plain, out of the tribe of Reuben, and Ramoth in Gilead, out of the tribe of Gad, and Golan in Bashan, out of the tribe of Manasseh.
speaker: Narrator

text: These were the cities appointed for all the children of Israel, and for the stranger that sojourned among them, that whosoever killed any person ignorantly, might flee thither, and not die by the hand of the avenger of blood, until he stood before the Congregation.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then came the principal fathers of the Levites unto Eleazar the Priest, and unto Joshua the son of Nun, and unto the chief fathers of the tribes of the children of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: And spake unto them at Shiloh in the land of Canaan, saying, The Lord commanded by the hand of Moses, to give us cities to dwell in, with the suburbs thereof for our cattle.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Israel gave unto the Levites, out of their inheritance at the commandment of the Lord these cities with their suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the lot came out for the families of the Kohathites: and the children of Aaron the Priest, which were of the Levites, had by lot, out of the tribe of Judah, and out of the tribe of Simeon, and out of the tribe of Benjamin thirteen cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the rest of the children of Kohath had by lot out of the families of the tribe of Ephraim, and out of the tribe of Dan, and out of the half tribe of Manasseh, ten cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the children of Gershon had by lot out of the families of the tribe of Issachar, and out of the tribe of Asher, and out of the tribe of Naphtali, and out of the half tribe of Manasseh in Bashan, thirteen cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: The children of Merari according to their families had out of the tribe of Reuben, and out of the tribe of Gad, and out of the tribe of Zebulun, twelve cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Israel gave by lot unto the Levites these cities with their suburbs, as the Lord had commanded by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they gave out of the tribe of the children of Judah, and out of the tribe of the children of Simeon, these cities which are here named.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they were the children of Aaron being of the families of the Kohathites, and of the sons of Levi, (for theirs was the first lot.)
speaker: Narrator

text: So they gave them Kirjath-arba of the father of Anak (which is Hebron) in the mountain of Judah, with the suburbs of the same round about it.
speaker: Narrator

text: (But the land of the city, and the villages thereof, gave they to Caleb the son of Jephunneh to be his possession.)
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus they gave to the children of Aaron the Priest, a city of refuge for the slayer, even Hebron with her suburbs, and Libnah with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Jattir with her suburbs, and Eshtemoa, and her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Holon with her suburbs, and Debir with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Ain with her suburbs, and Juttah with her suburbs, Beth Shemesh with her suburbs: nine cities out of those two tribes.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Benjamin they gave Gibeon with her suburbs, Geba with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Anathoth with her suburbs, and Almon with her suburbs: four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cities of the children of Aaron Priests, were thirteen cities with their suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: But to the families of the children of Kohath of the Levites, which were the rest of the children of Kohath (for the cities of their lot were out of the tribe of Ephraim.)
speaker: Narrator

text: They gave them the city of refuge for the slayer, Shechem with her suburbs in mount Ephraim, and Gezer with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: And Kibzaim with her suburbs, and Beth Horon with her suburbs: four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Dan, Eltekeh with her suburbs, Gibbethon with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Aijalon with her suburbs, Gath Rimmon with her suburbs: four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the half tribe of Manasseh, Tanach with her suburbs, and Gath Rimmon with her suburbs: two cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cities for the other families of the children of Kohath were ten with their suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also unto the children of Gershon of the families of the Levites, they gave out of the half tribe of Manasseh, the city of refuge for the slayer, Golan in Bashan with her suburbs, and Be Eshterah with her suburbs: two cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Issachar, Kishon with her suburbs, Daberath with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Jarmuth with her suburbs, En Gannim with her suburbs: four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Asher, Mishal with her suburbs, Abdon with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Helkath with her suburbs, and Rehob with her suburbs: four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Naphtali, the city of refuge for the slayer, Kedesh in Galilee with her suburbs, and Hammoth Dor with her suburbs, and Kartan with her suburbs: three cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: All the cities of the Gershonites according to their families, were thirteen cities with their suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also unto the families of the children of Merari the rest of the Levites, they gave out of the tribe of Zebulun, Jokneam with her suburbs, and Kartah with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Dimnah with her suburbs, Nahalal with her suburbs: four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer with her suburbs, and Jahaz with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Kedemoth with her suburbs, and Mephaath with her suburbs: four cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And out of the tribe of Gad they gave for a city of refuge for the slayer, Ramoth in Gilead with her suburbs, and Mahanaim with her suburbs,
speaker: Narrator

text: Heshbon with her suburbs, and Jazer with her suburbs: four cities in all.
speaker: Narrator

text: So all the cities of the children of Merari according to their families (which were the rest of the families of the Levites) were by their lot, twelve cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: And all the cities of the Levites within the possession of the children of Israel, were eight and forty with their suburbs.
speaker: Narrator

text: These cities lay every one severally with their suburbs round about them: so were all these cities.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the Lord gave unto Israel all the land, which he had sworn to give unto their fathers: and they possessed it, and dwelt therein.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also the Lord gave them rest round about according to all that he had sworn unto their fathers: and there stood not a man of all their enemies before them: for the Lord delivered all their enemies into their hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: There failed nothing of all the good things, which the Lord had said unto the house of Israel, but all came to pass.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua called the Reubenites, and the Gadites, and the half tribe of Manasseh,
speaker: Narrator

text: And said unto them, Ye have kept all that Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you, and have obeyed my voice in all that I commanded you:
speaker: Narrator

text: You have not forsaken your brethren this long season unto this day, but have diligently kept the commandment of the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And now the Lord hath given rest unto your brethren, as he promised them: therefore now return ye, and go to your tents, to the land of your possession, which Moses the servant of the Lord hath given you beyond Jordan.
speaker: Narrator

text: But take diligent heed, to do the commandment and Law, which Moses the servant of the Lord commanded you: that is, that ye love the Lord your God, and walk in all his ways, and keep his commandments, and cleave unto him, and serve him with all your heart, and with all your soul.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua blessed them, and sent them away, and they went unto their tents.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now unto one half of the tribe of Manasseh Moses had given a possession in Bashan: and unto the other half thereof gave Joshua among their brethren on this side Jordan Westward: therefore when Joshua sent them away unto their tents, and blessed them,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus he spake unto them, saying, Return with much riches unto your tents, and with a great multitude of cattle, with silver and with gold, with brass and with iron, and with great abundance of raiment: divide the spoil of your enemies with your brethren.
speaker: Narrator

text: So the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh returned, and departed from the children of Israel from Shiloh (which is in the land of Canaan) to go unto the country of Gilead to the land of their possession, which they had obtained according to the word of the Lord by the hand of Moses.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when they came unto the borders of Jordan (which are in the land of Canaan) then the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh, built there an altar by Jordan, a great altar to see too.
speaker: Narrator

text: When the children of Israel heard say, Behold, the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and the half tribe of Manasseh have built an altar in the forefront of the land of Canaan, upon the borders of Jordan at the passage of the children of Israel:
speaker: Narrator

text: When the children of Israel heard it, then the whole Congregation of the children of Israel gathered them together at Shiloh, to go up to war against them.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Israel sent unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh into the land of Gilead, Phinehas the son of Eleazar the Priest,
speaker: Narrator

text: And with him ten princes, of every chief house a prince, according to all the tribes of Israel: for every one was chief of their father’s household among the thousands of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: So they went unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the half tribe of Manasseh, unto the land of Gilead, and spake with them, saying,
speaker: Narrator

text: Thus saith the whole Congregation of the Lord, What transgression is this that ye have transgressed against the God of Israel, to turn away this day from the Lord, in that ye have built you an altar for to rebel this day against the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: Have we too little for the wickedness of Peor, whereof we are not cleansed unto this day, though a plague came upon the Congregation of the Lord?
speaker: Narrator

text: Ye also are turned away this day from the Lord: and seeing ye rebel today against the Lord, even tomorrow he will be wroth with all the Congregation of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: Notwithstanding, if the land of your possession be unclean, come ye over unto the land of the possession of the Lord, wherein the Lord’s Tabernacle dwelleth, and take possession among us: but rebel not against the Lord, nor rebel not against us in building you an altar, beside the altar of the Lord our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Did not Achan the son of Zerah trespass grievously in the execrable thing, and wrath fell on all the Congregation of Israel? and this man alone perished not in his wickedness.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad, and half the tribe of Manasseh answered, and said unto the heads over the thousands of Israel,
speaker: Narrator

text: The Lord God of gods, the Lord God of gods, he knoweth, and Israel himself shall know: if by rebellion, or by transgression against the Lord we have done it, save thou us not this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: If we have built us an altar to return away from the Lord, either to offer thereon burnt offering, or meat offering, or to offer peace offerings thereon, let the Lord himself require it:
speaker: Narrator

text: And if we have not rather done it for fear of this thing, saying, In time to come your children might say unto our children, What have ye to do with the Lord God of Israel?
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath made Jordan a border between us and you, ye children of Reuben and of Gad: therefore ye have no part in the Lord: so shall your children make our children cease from fearing the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore we said, We will now go about to make us an altar, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice,
speaker: Narrator

text: But it shall be a witness between us and you, and between our generations after us, to execute the service of the Lord before him, in our burnt offerings, and in our sacrifices, and in our peace offerings, and that your children should not say to our children in time to come, Ye have no part in the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore said we, If so be that they should so say to us, or to our generations in time to come, then will we answer, Behold the fashion of the altar of the Lord, which our fathers made, not for burnt offering, nor for sacrifice, but it is a witness between us and you.
speaker: Narrator

text: God forbid, that we should rebel against the Lord, and turn this day away from the Lord, to build an altar for burnt offering, or for meat offering, or for sacrifice, save the altar of the Lord our God that is before his Tabernacle.
speaker: Narrator

text: And when Phinehas the Priest, and the princes of the Congregation and heads over the thousands of Israel, which were with him, heard the words that the children of Reuben, and children of Gad, and the children of Manasseh spake, they were well content.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Phinehas the son of Eleazar the Priest said unto the children of Reuben, and to the children of Gad, and to the children of Manasseh, This day we perceive, that the Lord is among us, because ye have not done this trespass against the Lord: now ye have delivered the children of Israel out of the hand of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Phinehas the son of Eleazar the Priest with the princes, returned from the children of Reuben, and from the children of Gad, out of the land of Gilead, unto the land of Canaan, to the children of Israel, and brought them answer.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the saying pleased the children of Israel: and the children of Israel blessed God, and minded not to go against them in battle for to destroy the land, wherein the children of Reuben and Gad dwelt.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the children of Reuben, and the children of Gad called the altar Ed: for it shall be a witness between us, that the Lord is God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And a long season after that the Lord had given rest unto Israel from all their enemies round about, and Joshua was old, and stricken in age,
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua called all Israel, and their Elders, and their Heads, and their Judges, and their officers, and said unto them, I am old, and stricken in age.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also ye have seen all that the Lord your God hath done unto all these nations before you, how the Lord your God himself hath fought for you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Behold, I have divided unto you by lot these nations that remain, to be an inheritance according to your tribes, from Jordan, with all the nations that I have destroyed, even unto the great Sea Westward.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord your God shall expel them before you, and cast them out of your sight, and ye shall possess their land, as the Lord your God hath said unto you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Be ye therefore of a valiant courage to observe and do all that is written in the book of the Law of Moses, that ye turn not there from to the right hand nor to the left,
speaker: Narrator

text: Neither company with these nations: that is, with them that are left with you, neither make mention of the name of their gods, nor cause to swear by them, neither serve them, nor bow unto them:
speaker: Narrator

text: But stick fast unto the Lord your God, as ye have done unto this day.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord hath cast out before you great nations and mighty, and no man hath stood before your face hitherto.
speaker: Narrator

text: One man of you shall chase a thousand: for the Lord your God he fighteth for you, as he hath promised you.
speaker: Narrator

text: Take good heed therefore unto yourselves, that ye love the Lord your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Else, if ye go back, and cleave unto the rest of these nations: that is, of them that remain with you, and shall make marriages with them, and go unto them, and they to you,
speaker: Narrator

text: Know ye for certain, that the Lord your God will cast out no more of these nations from before you: but they shall be a snare and destruction unto you, and a whip on your sides, and thorns in your eyes, until ye perish out of this good land, which the Lord your God hath given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And behold, this day do I enter into the way of all the world, and ye know in all your hearts and in all your souls, that nothing hath failed of all the good things which the Lord your God promised you, but all are come to pass unto you: nothing hath failed thereof.
speaker: Narrator

text: Therefore as all good things are come upon you, which the Lord your God promised you, so shall the Lord bring upon you every evil thing, until he have destroyed you out of this good land, which the Lord your God hath given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: When ye shall transgress the Covenant of the Lord your God, which he commanded you, and shall go and serve other gods, and bow yourselves to them, then shall the wrath of the Lord wax hot against you, and ye shall perish quickly out of the good land which he hath given you.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua assembled again all the tribes of Israel to Shechem, and called the Elders of Israel, and their heads, and their Judges, and their officers, and they presented themselves before God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua said unto all the people, Thus saith the Lord God of Israel, Your fathers dwelt beyond the flood in old time, even Terah the father of Abraham, and the father of Nachor, and served other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I took your father Abraham from beyond the flood, and brought him through all the land of Canaan, and multiplied his seed, and gave him Isaac.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I gave unto Isaac, Jacob and Esau: and I gave unto Esau mount Seir, to possess it: but Jacob and his children went down into Egypt.
speaker: Narrator

text: I sent Moses also and Aaron, and I plagued Egypt: and when I had so done among them, I brought you out.
speaker: Narrator

text: So I brought your fathers out of Egypt, and ye came unto the Sea, and the Egyptians pursued after your fathers with chariots and horsemen unto the red Sea.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then they cried unto the Lord, and he put a darkness between you and the Egyptians, and brought the Sea upon them, and covered them: so your eyes have seen what I have done in Egypt: also ye dwelt in the wilderness a long season.
speaker: Narrator

text: After, I brought you into the land of the Amorites, which dwelt beyond Jordan, and they fought with you: but I gave them into your hand, and ye possessed their country, and I destroyed them out of your sight.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Balak the son of Zippor king of Moab, arose and warred against Israel, and sent to Balaam the son of Beor for to curse you,
speaker: Narrator

text: But I would not hear Balaam: therefore he blessed you, and I delivered you out of his hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And ye went over Jordan, and came unto Jericho, and the men of Jericho fought against you, the Amorites, and the Perizzites, and the Canaanites, and the Hittites, and the Girgashites, the Hivites, and the Jebusites, and I delivered them into your hand.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I sent hornets before you, which cast them out before you, even the two kings of the Amorites, and not with thy sword, nor with thy bow.
speaker: Narrator

text: And I have given you a land, wherein ye did not labor, and cities which ye built not, and ye dwell in them, and eat of the vineyards and olive trees, which ye planted not.
speaker: Narrator

text: Now therefore fear the Lord, and serve him in uprightness and in truth, and put away the gods, which your fathers served beyond the flood, and in Egypt, and serve ye the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And if it seem evil unto you to serve the Lord, choose you this day whom ye will serve, whether the gods which your fathers served (that were beyond the flood) or the gods of the Amorites, in whose land ye dwell: but I and mine house will serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then the people answered and said, God forbid, that we should forsake the Lord, to serve other gods.
speaker: Narrator

text: For the Lord our God, he brought us and our fathers out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and he did those great miracles in our sight, and preserved us in all the way that we went, and among all the people through whom we came.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the Lord did cast out before us all the people, even the Amorites which dwelt in the land: therefore will we also serve the Lord, for he is our God.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said unto the people, Ye cannot serve the Lord: for he is an holy God: he is a jealous God: he will not pardon your iniquity nor your sins.
speaker: Narrator

text: If ye forsake the Lord and serve strange gods, then he will return and bring evil upon you, and consume you, after that he hath done you good.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people said unto Joshua, Nay, but we will serve the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said unto the people, Ye are witnesses against yourselves, that ye have chosen you the Lord, to serve him: and they said, We are witnesses.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then put away now, said he, the strange gods which are among you, and bow your hearts unto the Lord God of Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the people said unto Joshua, The Lord our God will we serve, and his voice will we obey.
speaker: Narrator

text: So Joshua made a covenant with the people the same day, and gave them an ordinance and law in Shechem.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua wrote these words in the book of the Law of God and took a great stone, and pitched it there under an oak that was in the Sanctuary of the Lord.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Joshua said unto all the people, Behold, this stone shall be a witness unto us: for it hath heard all the words of the Lord which he spake with us: it shall be therefore a witness against you, lest you deny your God.
speaker: Narrator

text: Then Joshua let the people depart, every man unto his inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: And after these things, Joshua the son of Nun, the servant of the Lord died, being an hundred and ten years old.
speaker: Narrator

text: And they buried him in the border of his inheritance in Timnath Serah, which is in mount Ephraim, on the North side of mount Gaash.
speaker: Narrator

text: And Israel served the Lord all the days of Joshua, and all the days of the Elders that overlived Joshua, and which had known all the works of the Lord that he had done for Israel.
speaker: Narrator

text: And the bones of Joseph, which the children of Israel brought out of Egypt, buried they in Shechem in a parcel of ground, which Jacob bought of the sons of Hamor the father of Shechem, for an hundred pieces of silver, and the children of Joseph had them in their inheritance.
speaker: Narrator

text: Also Eleazar the son of Aaron died, whom they buried in the hill of Phinehas his son, which was given him in mount Ephraim.
speaker: Narrator
